title: Phase Field Crystals
description: Phase Field Crystals by J. Dantzig, B. Athreya, A. Chang, L. Kale and K. Wang

title: A Simulated Dendrite of Copper-Nickel Alloy
description: A simulated dendrite of a copper-nickel alloy as it is growing. The surface coloring represents the relative concentration of each of the two metals at the surface of the dendrite.

title: Multiphase Flow
description: Simulation results of a rotating drum with three-phase flow, performed by a COMSOL Multiphysics user with equation-based modeling. The description used in this new flow interface, the Three-Phase Flow, Phase Field interface, is a separated multiphase flow model.

title: Phase field models
description: From Baasansuren Jadamba at Rochester Institute of Technology

title: Phase Field Modeling simulation for Ostwald ripening
description: D.Fan, S. P. Chen, L. -Q. Chen, and P. W. Voorhees, "Phase-field simulation of 2-D Ostwald ripening in the high volume fraction regime " Acta Mater. 50, 1895 (2002)

title: Dendritic growth using the phase field method
description: Simulated using FiPy.

title: SAMR, phase-field simulation of dendritic growth
description: Structured adaptive mesh refinement - phase-field simulation of dendritic growth during solidification. (Image courtesy of Chin Yi Chee at IHPC)

title: Phase Field Crystal Modeling of Microstructure Development
description: The evolving density field for a simulation of heterogeneous nucleation and growth in an undercooled melt.

title: Ginzburg-Landau Equation
description: The phase field resulting from a simulation of the complex Ginzburg-Landau equation. Several frames from a 100 x 100 domain with 512x512 grid points. See Target waves in the complex Ginzburg-Landau equation, Phys. Rev. E 62, 7627-7631 (2000)

title: Phase Field Model for Grain Growth with Second Phase
description: Moelans N., Blanpain B., Wollants P., "A phase field model for the simulation of grain growth in materials containing finely dispersed incoherent second-phase particles", Acta Mater., 53 (6), 1771-1781, 2005

title: Solidification Simulation
description: Phase-Field Simulation of Solidification (Collaborator: Prof. Christoph Beckermann, University of Iowa)

title: MOOSE -- Periodic strain boundary condition
description: Phase field mechanics coupling with periodic strain boundary conditions.

description: Phase-Field Simulation of Solidification (Collaborator: Prof. Christoph Beckermann, University of Iowa)

title: Dendritic Growth with Surface Tension Anisotropy
description: Typical computations of thermal dendrites grown at high undercooling. We simulate a dendritic crystal starting from a circular nucleus growing into an undercooled melt.

description: Atomistic Modeling of Crystal Plasticity and Creep Deformation with the Phase Field Crystal Approach

title: Localized solutions of the phase-field crystal equation
description: Steady-state localized solutions of the conserved Swift-Hohenberg (or phase-field crystal) equation. For details see U. Thiele, A. J. Archer, M. J. Robbins, H. Gomez and E. Knobloch, Phys. Rev. E 87, 042915 (2013).

title: Phase Field Crystals
description: Phase Field Crystals by J. Dantzig, B. Athreya, A. Chang, L. Kale and K. Wang

title: Cahn-Hilliard Simulation
description: Longer term dynamics of the conservative phase field evolution using the Cahn-Hilliard formulation.

title: Phase Field Theory of Polycrystalline Freezing
description: A phase field theory of polycrystalline solidification that incorporates noise-induced nucleation of grains with different crystallographic orientations, the effect of foreign particles, and polycrystalline branching with fixed orientational misfit.

description: Typical computations of thermal dendrites grown at high undercooling. We simulate a dendritic crystal starting from a circular nucleus growing into an undercooled melt.

description: K. R. Elder and M. Grant, "Modeling elastic and plastic deformations in nonequilibrium processing using phase field crystals" Phys. Rev. E 70, 051605 (2004)

title: PHASE FIELD MODELING
description: The evolution of binary mixtures (miscible or immiscible) can be modeled by means of nonlinear parabolic PDEs, involving second or high order differential operators.

title: Wikipedia Phase Field Entry
description: A phase field model is a mathematical model for solving interfacial problems. It has mainly been applied to solidification dynamics, but it has also been applied to other situations such as viscous fingering, fracture dynamics, vesicle dynamics, etc.
